body: /run agent-plugin-test-3
/run ci
Please move this as a record in WIKI. We may need this someday.
This is not a communication issue, every time you shutdown the agent, the TCP broken, and you got this at server side.
There is no endpoint by time, it doesn't have the heartbeat. You need to learn deeper.

the code already support both register time and heartbeat time, i just add a new searchEndpoint and convet duration argument into start time and end time, of cause the underlying method should also be added to accept the time arguments, just like the way seachAllService did.

I just wander why not allow to expose data that already exists in storage by hard-code filters in the common method such as searchEndpoint(), shouldnâ€™t it be much common to pass filter conditions into the method?
Please do not merge this PR yet, I also have an enhance to the plugin
Ping us after you done.
I set up a schedule and set a baseline of when the skywalking online in our environment, and it will search endpoint within a scrolling time period to help building up a schematic of our system
@kezhenxu94 @tristaZero I have shut down the e2e tests, which seems it is endless retrying. I am assuming something is going wrong.
@wu-sheng @dmsolr Hi, I added the ```io.undertow.server.HttpServerExchange#dispatch(Executor, Runnable)``` intercept, please review.

> Hi, I added the io.undertow.server.HttpServerExchange#dispatch(Executor, Runnable) intercept, please review.

Is this a missing intercept point? What is the case we need this, and existing interceptors are not supported? Could you give some introduce?
I have added the test case into Jenkinsfile-Agent-Test file, why is it not running on Agent Plugin Tests Workload 1?
It is running. The graph only updates after it runs once.

> It is running. The graph only updates after it runs once.

good, have resolved test case bug. contact me if it has any problem.
@dmsolr Please continue.
@kezhenxu94 add sql param is done. second i want to move some pg common in sub module postgresql-commons, what do you think?
I'm going to make CI skip when **only **/*.md** is modified

> I'm going to make CI skip when **only /*.md is modified

Make sense to me.
I am holding this PR to verfiy #3722
@mrproliu  Please verify the case, the test still fails.
/run ci
/run agent-plugin-test-2
I will immigreate apm-toolkit-trace-scenario #3739
License header missing.

> two questions:
> 1: if we plan to use three backend as a cluster by using consul, the agent's collector.backend_service setting is still one of the collector's IP, right?
> 2: Is it still necessary to use LB between agent and collector when use a collector cluster? why? if it's called cluster, it is strange that no embeded route service to dispatch requests to all collector service evenly.

Do you have answers to these two questions
@arugal Got it, the case status is just updated.
Why access so many times?

> The changes don't make sense to me. I assume, you should consider to change verify times, not read time.

There are two scenarios:
1. ```EntryService``` could not respond, it could be a code bug or something, so we need to set a timeout.
2. ```EntryService``` takes 7 seconds or more to respond, but eventually it will respond, it has to do with code or vm, so we need a long timeout.

So what we need is a timeout, not a retry

> This is only trying to access receive data, but you don't verify. Why add this?

I can rollback

1. If it is a test code bug, we should fix it. Rather than supporting this in tesr framework.
1. What codes need 3 seconds for test? We have given health check to do preparation, right?
1. We could make longer timeout, but you are adding retry time, which are different.

>  1. If it is a test code bug, we should fix it. Rather than supporting this in tesr framework.

Yes, but should we let the ```agent-plugin-tests``` end and show failure instead of remaining pending

> 2. What codes need 3 seconds for test? We have given health check to do preparation, right?

for [kafka-scenario](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/test/plugin/scenarios/kafka-scenario/src/main/java/test/org/apache/skywalking/apm/testcase/kafka/controller/CaseController.java), may have a 10-second waiting for ```consumer``` to complete,  but waiting is required, otherwise the use case might fail because of the lack of ```operationNames```

> 3. We could make longer timeout, but you are adding retry time, which are different.

``` -m, --max-time <seconds> Maximum time allowed for the transfer``` that's the help of curl,  what did I missï¼Ÿ

I mean, for Kafka, the lack of operation name may not relate to this. 
Do you check why the operation name missing? My guess is the message consuming take more time, rather than the entry service timeout. But the timeout clearly is not for that. Could you explain?
@kezhenxu94 done

@tristaZero has contributed this. Thanks.

FYI @kezhenxu94 I just keep a record here, #3648 e2e test depends on the `application.yml`(dist package) storage config item order very much. If @tristaZero or you have time, should consider improving it. It may fail unexpectedly someday in the future, but we don't remember there is an implicit rule we added here.

Agent autotest framework has been provided, and 300+ test cases have been added. Seems working well. Just working for @dmsolr to provide the official documents, rather than guide users to do that one by one.

> My guess is the message consuming take more time

Yes, so I need to wait for the ```ConsumerThread``` to finish in ```EntryService```

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/7f69a73d1312888a20489e8429dd65f3d10a52b1/test/plugin/scenarios/kafka-scenario/src/main/java/test/org/apache/skywalking/apm/testcase/kafka/controller/CaseController.java#L66-L87

> rather than the entry service timeout. But the timeout clearly is not for that.

I think I've answered that one, why a timeout? why a long timeout, ```kafka-scenario``` is an example of an ```EntryService``` that requires 3 seconds or more

> Do you check why the operation name missing?

I will provide the corresponding test code.
I think kafka consume period is configurable, which could be in milliseconds, is that right?  My point is that, it may need more time, but it is not timeout, it should be a validation retry.
I am not arguing about the more time thing, it is about how to set more time.
@dmsolr Could you help about this?

I think it is not business about any test cases.
Before #3716, the test-framework visit to any URL without a timeout. But we spot which will block for a long time(serval hours) in #3698 .
I think @arugal means what a 3s is too short to visit `EntryService` so that unstable in lack of resource.

For many cases,  we get the responses immediately, but sometimes it will take more time. I think 30-60s is enough.

My question is why accessing `EntryService` needs 30s? Is this the reasonable case for codes? Especially, we are talking about test codes. If we accept this kind of latency, what we expect from the time of running all cases?
Personally, I don't believe there is a service, no matter we wrote or another OSS, which requires so long time to respond in such low traffic access.
I know @arugal 's meaning, but could you give a real case, and , I would like to discuss it. @dmsolr What codes you met need 30 sec?
In fact, I don't meet yet. But I think it is no harm.

> In fact, I don't meet yet. But I think it is no harm.

Actually, it is. Because we will never know who will contribute test codes need to wait for a long time, and causing our INFRA resource with meaningless.
Hi, I may have not expressed clearly, please give me a little time, I will comb through and provide corresponding examples. @wu-sheng @dmsolr @kezhenxu94
Sure, take your time.
/run e2e
yes, i want to add pg10
Make sense.
Now pg10 and above are mainstream, and the meaning before maintenance is not big.
@zhaoyuguang Could you check this locally?
ok

The old thread graph is like this.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/67658980-2ef92000-f996-11e9-87db-c0ef51745b29.png)

As we have improved many other points for the performance, this seems a missing one. As this was reported, and no one submitted PR, I am trying to do this.
@yantaowu I think you mentioned this before, could you check about this too?
@lkxiaolou As you was working on optimizing DataCarrier multiple times, could you help on rechecking this too?
A question related to #3725, this PR seems to have no plugin codes, then why we need PostgreSQL common module? I know it is harmless, but I am assuming you are going to reuse those codes.
The versions of the driver seem crazy, do you have recommendation to reduce some? Or @dmsolr @kezhenxu94 the workload 4 seems Inevitable, WDYT?

Additional, I think as we have optimized the test running conditions, we may could have a new one. I hope the 4 should be enough to provide all tests running in one hour. We still have a long list of plugins, but most of them have less versions.

> A question related to #3725, this PR seems to have no plugin codes, then why we need PostgreSQL common module? I know it is harmless, but I am assuming you are going to reuse those codes.

Maybe I have misunderstood before. pg-8.x-plugin already supports pg10. At present, 8-plugin is already supported. When there is a big pg-jdbc version, it should be put into pg-9.x-plugin. I think so, everyone thinks it can be Suitable?

> Maybe I have misunderstood before. pg-8.x-plugin already supports pg10. At present, 8-plugin is already supported. When there is a big pg-jdbc version, it should be put into 9.x-plugin. I think so, everyone thinks it can be Suitable?

If in that case, we may not need the PostgreSQL common for now, because you don't know the next version, you don't know what they look like, and what plugin do you need to build. So, common is not the real common package :)
Is it OK to revert it back?
In fact, I have a plan that will increase the intercept extension function of pg. The contents of these extensions will be placed in postgresql-9.x-plugin, but the current priority will be lower.

> In fact, I have a plan that will increase the intercept extension function of pg. The contents of these extensions will be placed in postgresql-9.x-plugin, but the current priority will be lower.

If this is an additional feature, especially for 9.x plugin, it is OK to do. It is a separated situation of #3725
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37059529/67668215-72f62000-f9aa-11e9-82a7-6e588c9f752c.png)
Next, I will complete the second step.
ACK. It is not necessary at present. Can I wait until later if I need to add it?
What dou you mean wait?
Could you recreate branch to do this? A lot of unrelated commits.
The latest PG version is already PG12, and it is not clear whether current version can support it.
You could choose any time you need to add it back. I just mean, we don't need it now.

> > > I will immigrate elasticsearch-5.x-scenario
> > 
> > 
> > For elasticsearch client, I could 6.x and 7.x could be tested, if not supported, I hope it could be contributed/added. @aderm
> 
> ok, it's my pleasure. @wu-sheng

@wu-sheng Next, I want to extend es-6.x-pluginï¼Œbecuause transport is not recommend by elastic official, i will think out http rest client. What do you think?
ACK
Make sense to me. I think we could provide a separated 6.x or 7.x plugin.
OK

> The versions of the driver seem crazy, do you have recommendation to reduce some? Or @dmsolr @kezhenxu94 the workload 4 seems Inevitable, WDYT?

I prefer combining them into one workload, according to my attempt and comment [here](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/3714#issuecomment-546408930), combining them into one and we can still make them run in different nodes(without stashing, every node compiles like what we do now), the benefit is that it will make full use of the resources, auto occupy all available executors whenever possible, and queueing automatically when no more executors available
But like I said last time, the 100m dist package is my concern. The task is already fully used. Even we set static allocate rules.
And every time, we have to rerun all tasks if only one timeout. Make sense?
can you show some results or logsï¼Ÿ

> But like I said last time, the 100m dist package is my concern.

"without stashing", what I mean is every node will run compile-test process, like what we are doing now, no networking transmission

> The task is already fully used. Even we set static allocate rules.

I don't think so, it's fully used when all the nodes are busy, but if we have only one PR, there is 3 workloads, occupying 3 vm nodes, and the other 2 vm nodes are idle, after combining them into one workload, no matter how many PR's are opened, we will try to make as many nodes busy as possible

> And every time, we have to rerun all tasks if only one timeout. Make sense?

that's what I would propose, to retry the failed stage/task automatically ( for a certain times, say 3 times), this can be also done within Jenkins itself, without changing test framework
Lets open another issue to discuss this. Seems like a longer discussion.
@dfkjadkfj

throw IOException when case servlet closes HttpServletResponse.

You should not use it directly. It need mock collector running AFAIK.

1. This is the Jenkins log screenshot of undertow-scenario submitted earlier, because the bug in the use case blocked the test for 2 hours. 
(è¿™æ˜¯ä¹‹å‰æäº¤```undertow-scenario```æ—¶çš„Jenkinsæ—¥å¿—æˆªå›¾ï¼Œå› ä¸ºç”¨ä¾‹çš„bugé˜»å¡žäº†æµ‹è¯•2å°æ—¶)
![WechatIMG7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26432832/67680206-bdd16100-f9c5-11e9-8389-f06914abc14b.png)
there is no possibility of retrying, so we need to timeout
2.  The ```EntryService``` of ```kafka-scenario``` needs to wait for ```ConsumerThread``` to complete before it can respond, which may take up to 10s. If you don't wait or time out by 3 seconds, the mock-collector may not have received all the data yet. Here, EntryService blocking is reasonable in my view (```kafka-scenario```çš„```EntryService```éœ€è¦ç­‰å¾…ConsumerThreadå®Œæˆæ‰èƒ½å“åº”ï¼Œæœ€é•¿å¯èƒ½ç­‰å¾…10s, å¦‚æžœä¸ç­‰å¾…æˆ–è€…3ç§’è¶…æ—¶ï¼Œmock-collectorå¯èƒ½è¿˜æ²¡æœ‰æ”¶åˆ°å…¨éƒ¨çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œè¿™å„¿EntryServiceé˜»å¡žæˆ‘è®¤ä¸ºæ˜¯åˆç†çš„)
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/b3da85b52684834f0e39a02ef6998499db81327a/test/plugin/scenarios/kafka-scenario/src/main/java/test/org/apache/skywalking/apm/testcase/kafka/controller/CaseController.java#L66-L87
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/b3da85b52684834f0e39a02ef6998499db81327a/test/plugin/scenarios/kafka-scenario/src/main/java/test/org/apache/skywalking/apm/testcase/kafka/controller/CaseController.java#L158-L191

3. I modified ```undertow-scenario``` on fork project, ```EntryService``` slept for 8 seconds before responding, and the probability of missing ```operationNames``` was almost 100 percent. However, we changed the timeout time of ```EntryService``` to 30 seconds or 60 seconds, which could be avoided, not affecting normal use cases, but improving stability for special use cases like ```kafka ```
(æˆ‘ä¿®æ”¹äº†forké¡¹ç›®ä¸Šçš„undertow-scenarioï¼ŒEntryServiceä¼‘çœ 8ç§’æ‰å“åº”ï¼Œç¼ºå°‘operationNamesçš„æ¦‚çŽ‡å‡ ä¹Žç™¾ä¹‹ç™¾ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯æˆ‘ä»¬å°†EntryServiceçš„è¶…æ—¶æ—¶é—´æ”¹åˆ°30ç§’æˆ–è€…60ç§’å°±å¯ä»¥é¿å…ï¼Œå¯¹äºŽæ­£å¸¸çš„ç”¨ä¾‹æ²¡æœ‰å½±å“ï¼Œå¯¹äºŽkafkaè¿™æ ·ç‰¹æ®Šçš„ç”¨ä¾‹èƒ½æé«˜ç¨³å®šæ€§)

https://github.com/arugal/skywalking/blob/113e0811bb7b091ac7373265cd23dfab4393b386/test/plugin/scenarios/undertow-scenario/config/actualData.yaml#L1-L48

First of all, is really kafka consumer requiring 10s? I remember kafka read period could be configurated? Do you try to resolve this?
If we accept 60s, even 10s, then every case could do a long sleep and say, we want to be more stable. But really?
I think that we need to add some docs in this dir, tell our user about preconditions. such as `kubectl` and `helm` tools should be installed before.

> I think that we need to add some docs in this dir, tell our user about preconditions. such as `kubectl` and `helm` tools should be installed before.

This feature just for skywalking CI?
CI is the first priority, so it is just being merged into istio-ci branch.
I am running the test again to recheck stability
/run agent-plugin-test-1
@dmsolr Please review
SkyWalking's receiver is hard coded for format transfer today. Unless we have an explicit transfer description, it is hard to do this plugin, no matter at telegraf output or SkyWalking receiver.
